alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 17 at 7:58PM CST until December 19 at 9:50AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood East Gate affecting Pulaski County. .Heavy rainfall across the basin will result in the Big Piney River below Fort Leonard Wood East Gate to rise above flood stage. For the Big Piney River...including Fort Leonard Wood East Gate... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood East Gate. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, the Happy Hollow Picnic Area floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Friday the stage was 2.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 9.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.0 feet on 03/14/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday evening at 800 PM CST.
